course_description: Emphasizes the underlying concepts of the epidemiological approach, stressing study design. Discusses the calculation and interpretation of measures of frequency, association, and public health impact. Discusses sources of study error including the influence of chance, bias, confounding, and effect modification. Basic concepts of standardizing rates, surveillance, and screening are also introduced. Non-EPI students only who have not taken EPI 530.
